name: Hilton Checkers Los Angeles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed one night while in town for an event at the convention center. I don't think there's much going on nearby the hotel itself, but I could be wrong. We took a taxi everywhere we needed to go and it was never far. Hotel has a small bar and rooms are nice but smallish. If you want to be able to walk to places from the hotel, best to check the map before booking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel downtown

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel many times and just love it! The staff is great and the service is fantastic. Love the upstairs pool! As a Platinum HHonors Member they offer me a choice between points or a breakfast and I love my points. I know some are ticked off not getting the breakfast (yes people it is only for Platinum members) but I love my points. Thank you to the team and i recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: I agree that this is a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a fantastic stay here and have nothing negative to say. Yes, the room is a little small, but how much time do you usually stay in your room? The view from the rooftop deck was spectacular - not too noisy or busy when we were there. The staff was very gracious and accomodating. The bed was fantastic and the room was very quiet. We went across the street to the Biltmore for a nightcap and were very glad to come back to the peace and quiet of Hilton Checkers. The staff also informed us that they do have shuttle service to the concert halls that are up Bunker Hill from the hotel - another great perk! However, I do not recommend it for a family with children as it is a more upscale establishment.
reviews.title: What a great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean rooms, comfey bed, nicely decorated rooms, and relatively quiet (depending on the room you get), nice toiletries. Great downtown location. But it's a small hotel with minimal services. The rooms are very small. No shuttle service. Front desk staff were not knowledgable about much. One, pricey restaurant. Swimming pool is a "look at" pool. Good for sitting in (a lane wide and about four strokes long) but not swimming. Don't let the hotel pictures on the web fool you. Definately not the place for kids.
reviews.title: It's a boutique hotel - don't let the Hilton name fool you

reviews.text: For gold members, the perks are mimal. Don't count on any upgrades. Breakfast coupon is for continental only and the restaurant opens late; not until 8 on Sunday.
reviews.title: Average.....

reviews.text: I loved the Hilton Checkers. The staff is super friendly. The hotel has a nice bar/lounge on the first floor. We had some tasty drinks there. We also took our drinks up to the rooftop pool/lounge area. That was one of the best features of the hotel. While the hours posted indicated that the rooftop closed at 10 p.m., the hotel kept it open all night. While we didn't swim or use the hot tub, it was nice to be able to hang out up there with drinks late into the night. Our rooms were tastefully decorated. My only complain was that there are no small refrigerators in the rooms even though there's a spot for them. I thought the shower was particularly wonderful. Great water pressure. The bathroom itself was well done. If I had to be near downtown again for any reason, I would definitely stay at the Hilton Checkers again.
reviews.title: An Uptown Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: Also, while the parking is valet only, the valets were exceptionally nice and very quick when retrieving our car.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great rooftop views

reviews.text: We used points to stay here in August. It would be good for business downtown. Obviously there is not much else to do downtown, and there was not a lot in the way of restaurants or shopping nearby. We only stayed one night (passing through LA basically) but everyone we interacted with was very welcoming and helpful. The views from the rooftop pool were great, although the ambience was a little weird - I had expected a bar but instead there were two groups of people drinking beer they had purchased at a grocery store somewhere (they were pulling it out of bags). The pool itself was tiny and probably more for looking at than actually swimming in. Gym was really tiny with about three pieces of old equipment.
reviews.title: Hilton Checkers was great as long as the company pays!

reviews.text: The Hilton Checkers was really nice, we went to the Adobe Max Conference and the accommodations were paid for by my company. The beds were so comfortable, I haven't had such a good sleep in decades. The pillows and mattresses were perfect, the heating/cooling was at my fingertips and worked. The room was quiet despite Batman being filmed right outside my bedroom window. The room service was great and so were the hotel staff. Free paper every morning and no complaints about the cleaners. The only thing I'd say they could improve on is giving free internet service. At $10/day it's too expensive and this is the day and age where it's not cool to penny pinch on this service as it's a must for every working person. The internet was iffy at best even though I paid a small fortune for it. The furnishings in my room were very current and stylish and I'm sad I didn't have time to use the rooftop pool. Thanks Hilton for a great stay, at $200/night I would never choose to spend my personal money this way but was such a treat being paid for on business.
reviews.title: Great Location but Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many excellent breakfast places on the walk to the conference centre and lots of great restaurants and pubs in the area too. I recommend the sushi place Mitaki on 6th for great/inexpensive sushi, Bottega Louie Gourmet Market for breakfast, The Wokano for happy hour and Santee St Alley for the local cultural experience.
reviews.title: Great location in downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel, Great room & service, not an overly large room, quite cosy but big Californian King bed and good size bathroom, coffee machine in the room, bar fridge which is usable..meaning you can put your own things in it if you want, great spa and pool over looking the city, great little resturant down the bottom of hotel, food great and not over priced, clean room and very happy people willing to look after you...I booked the room on one of those last minute web sites and it included a buffet breakfast as part of the deal, despite this, the hotel had no reference of this being the case, when I pointed out that I had made the booking online and it did include the deal the guy at the service desk kindly gave me a free breakfast pass for me and my wife without an issue or argument..it wasnt a Buffet but we were able to choose plenty to eat from the Menu and there were no issues...there also was cheap parking in a car garage right next door which was a cheaper alternative to Valet but beware rates change depending on what night of the week making Valet they way to go..cheapest on weekends and the price jumps bigtime during the week....great little Hotel, if I had to stay in LA again I would stay here.... ..
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member and rarely take the time to write about the Hilton properties that a stay in each month - but this one deserves a nod.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - Centrally Located

reviews.text: Lovely marble foyer, doorman and reception always went out of their way to assist on two separate weekly stays recently.
reviews.title: Very cool place, would do it again...BUT

reviews.text: Rooms run a little on the small side for a Hilton, but plenty big enough for 1-2 persons.
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back.

reviews.text: Nice cozy and quiet lobby bar that also has free coffee in the mornings.
reviews.title: I can't believe this is a Hilton property!

reviews.text: This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at for business in awhile. On a scale of 1-10, 10 being the best, I give it a 9.
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodations Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful. I was originally given a room right by the 2nd floor elevators. I was not thrilled with this. I went down to the front desk and they quickly changed my room to a higher floor and sent someone to help me haul my luggage to the new room.
reviews.title: Pick another hotel

reviews.text: The hotel restaurant and room service are very good. Room was clean and for the money being spent, it was well worth it. My only complaint was that parking is expensive, and is quite a walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Hilton I've stayed at

reviews.text: Bottom line, If I were to visit the Downtown LA area again, I would choose the Hilton Checkers.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: Was informed at check-in that the rooftop and pool was closed because of a private party, very unfortunate because that was one of the reasons we chose the hotel. First morning we chose to eat our breakfast at the hotel restaurant. The staff was confused, there were dishes left on most tables. In normal cases that would make us turn around and walk away, but we were on a tight schedule this particular day, so we decided to give it a try. The waiter dropped food on my wife and instantly said "s**t. that was my fault" .. doh! We did not receive the tea we ordered, and the check was given to us before we even finished our meal. The internet connection is a joke, it's disconnecting on a regular basis, and the access point keeps disappearing. We got billed three times, but we only accessed the login page once.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a weekend stay with friends

reviews.text: The Checkers in LA Downtown is not very special. The beds are good, the staff is (European) friendly, but you couldn't tell that you were in LA - could have been any other random Hilton worldwide.
reviews.title: Standard Hilton hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When staying at the Checkers, I recommed to prepare your stay. Downtown, especially in the weekend, can be a bit desolate in the evenings when you are walking around in search for a restaurant. Lots of empty streets, closed windows etc.
reviews.title: nice but very expensive

reviews.text: Oh, and if you want to swim: check before if the pool is open, during my stay it was closed due to renovation. But they are also renting it out for parties - so it might be closed at other times as well.
reviews.title: Cool boutique hotel...will stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: small lobby area , real nice size rooms .located in middle of downtown .A car is a must to go to tourist spots.no parking 35 a night valet.and 400 a room kind of steep.friendly staff and decent room service food but pricey.close to lakers ,nokia center but not walking distance as I had been told.
reviews.title: Great service! Beautiful boutique hotel! We'll be back.

reviews.text: This was actually a combination leisure and business trip. I was made to stay at this property because my Company has an "approved" list of hotels we have to choose from now. So I didn't really want to like the hotel...but I REALLY did.
reviews.title: Hard to believe this is a Hilton property

reviews.text: Reserved a king. Upon arrival at five pm was informed that a king was not available. No apologies, no upgrade. I asked the clerk for an explanation and the reply was a repeat that the room I reserved was not available. The room I did get had a non working desk lamp, which was promptly repaired. The non working, though advertised, wireless Internet connection, so far has not been repaired. With many choices downtown LA I won't stay here again.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere.

reviews.text: Our travel plans were mostly decided through Trip Advisor. We were going to a Lakers' game and wanted a hotel near the Staples Center. We were w/in walking distance of the Staples Center and the rooms were nice; however, we had just left a hotel in West Hollywood of similar price/ranking and they provided free WiFi, free breakfast and the room had a refrigerator....none of these 3 were provided by the Hilton. We were also attracted to the property by the roof top pool, which is just as nice as the pictures portray; however, it was too chilly for us to indulge. I gave the Service a 3 b/c we didn't really "use" their Service. It was a nice hotel w/in walking distance of our main event, but more amenities could have been provided for the cost.
reviews.title: Nice room close to our event....

reviews.text: I've traveled to LA for work a few times recently, and this hotel has exceeded the other downtown hotels at which I've stayed! The location is great, the public spaces in the hotel are nice, and the rooms are fantastic. The service really goes above and beyond, even checking in after I arrived to make sure everything was satisfactory. The rooftop pool & jacuzzi was awesome.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Gold status policy disappointing

reviews.text: The only area of disappointment is the treatment of Hilton Honors Gold status members, of which I am one. At every other Hilton family property I've stayed at, I've been given a free breakfast as is the policy. I heard from colleagues that used to be true at this property, but recently they changed the policy to just a "continental breakfast". Some continental breakfasts aren't so bad; here, the first day, I was just given 3 bread-ish items and a plate of fruit. It was good, but it seemed really cheap on Hilton's part. Then it got worse -- the 2nd day, my server told me the fruit plate wasn't included! I complained a bit, he said he would see what he could do, and magically a fruit plate did appear, but I only had 2 bread items -- was he trying to "stick it to me"? Overall, this just seems like a really cheap attitude, toward loyal customers. I'm not saying I expect lobster and caviar with my breakfast, but something that at least is satisfying would be nice and in keeping with other Hilton properties.
reviews.title: Pretty, historic hotel that misses on a few key amenities

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights on a business trip with meetings at the LA Convention Center. THe hotel is in a good, central location for Downtown LA destinations. The valet and bell staff are very friendly and attentive as are the front desk attendants.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: We chose Hilton Checkers to be our wedding block. Rooms were clean and beds were very new from what we heard from our guests. We had Yolanda to help us with our wedding block. She seems very professional at first but then she was very forgetful. We told her that we needed a wheelchair accessible room for our wedding block but she forgot about it. We told her we wanted both 2 beds and 1 bed rooms for our guests. Later, one of our guests called us and said they were unable to book 2 bed bedrooms on a day. I called Yolanda and questioned her. She said that day on our block was all 1 bed bedrooms. She said if the guests want 2 beds, they could call the hotel. I told her that we don’t want our guests to trouble with calling the hotel. It made us seem unorganized for not having options ready for them. We had a little argument. In the end, I told her to switch all those rooms to 2 bed bedrooms. She asked what if our guests want 1 bed bedrooms. I told her that they could call the hotel to switch it to that then.
reviews.title: Wedding Block

reviews.text: On our cut off day, our rooms weren’t booked enough to get an upgrade for our wedding night. So, Yolanda gave us the upgrade anyway. We got a penthouse and it was very big and beautiful. It was prefect for doing our makeup/hair and photos before the wedding. At night, it was a little too cold. The heater wasn’t working in the bedroom. The bathroom’s bathtub was a little small for penthouse.
reviews.title: Lovely staff, very comfortable, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the end, our wedding block was all filled up. Yolanda told us that if we had guests who needed more rooms for our special rate, the hotel will give them the rate if there are rooms left in the hotel.
reviews.title: Better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of our guests tried to get more rooms during our wedding block, but the hotel didn’t give her the special rate. They told her the wedding block is full and so she can’t get the special rate. We knew there were a lot of rooms in the hotel available, but they still didn’t give her the rate.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent location, but it's the service that puts it over the top

reviews.text: In conclusion, we would have still blocked rooms at the Hilton even if we know all this would have happened. It was the closest hotel to our wedding venue. Their rooms were very clean and their beds were very new. We do think they need to work on training their employees.
reviews.title: LA short stay

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on this website, I was actually afraid to stay at this hotel. But I liked it. My family and I stayed at this hotel over the July 4th holiday and we found the accommodations to be clean and pleasant. The staff was also very friendly. We wanted to stay downtown so we could be close to the train. This hotel was only 3 blocks away from the train station and so it was very easy to get to Universal Studios, Walk of Fame, etc ... Disneyland was a short 30 minute drive away. Richard at the front desk was so helpful in getting us sorted out each day. And Leon was so cheerful and friendly in handling our luggage, valeting our rental car etc.... We ate breakfast one morning in the hotel dining and the food was amazing. A little pricey, but amazing. There is also a Starbucks at the end of the block and several restaurants within walking distance if you prefer casual, cheap dining. All in all, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: I liked it

reviews.text: This is not your typical Hilton but that was a good thing! Very stylishly designed. The rooms were standard but spacious. Everything was updated and clean. The restaurant seemed a little pricey but there are good places to eat within walking distance... just ask the bellmen. They were very helpful!
reviews.title: Spacious room and cute hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed here when we had an AC outage in our apartment. Overall, great stay.
reviews.title: Very convenient!

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Wonderful service, clean, comfortable, noisy.

reviews.text: * Good facilities, elevators working, pool is small but nice, etc.
reviews.title: Very nice downtown hotel

description: Hilton Checkers Los Angeles Hotel is an historic hotel in Los Angeles that dates back to the 1920s, fully restored to its original splendor. The full service Hilton Checkers Los Angeles Hotel in downtown Los Angeles offers extensive hotel luxuries combined with an intimate ambiance and personalized service unlike any other Los Angeles hotel. One feature not to be overlooked: A stunning rooftop deck showcasing a breathtaking view of the Los Angeles skyline, a perfect setting for receptions or romantic getaways.
